page.title: 10St Mary's Hospital
page.content: St Mary's Hospital is the local Old peoples hospital. There are 58 beds there, but they also take 25 day patients. The patients ages have ranged from 65 to 110.There are 53 full time nurses and one consultant who comes up from Plymouth.The hospital takes patients from a very wide area and is always full. In 1984 they had 110 admissions,70 discharges and only 30 deaths. Many of the elderly patients have physical problems and there are special support staff to help them such as occupational therapists and physiotherapists.St.Mary's was originally built as the Union workhouse.There are plans for the hospital to be rebuilt behind the General Hospital.
